elements.content: Empowering Displaced Students Through Cloud Education

Through AWS cloud education, we empower displaced students with critical technical skills for careers in cloud computing, data analytics, and software development. Our comprehensive curriculum combines hands-on training with mentorship and career support, creating pathways to economic opportunity for those affected by conflict.

Students learn essential AWS services including EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, and CloudFormation through real-world projects and industry-standard best practices. Each student completes hands-on labs and earns AWS certifications.
Professional mentors from AWS and partner companies provide guidance on resume building, interview preparation, and career planning. Students participate in mock interviews and networking events.
Photo: Students learning AWS services in Kyiv, Ukraine

Since launching in 2022, the Together for Ukraine program has achieved remarkable results: 50,000+ students trained across 15 countries, 85% job placement rate within 6 months of graduation, and partnerships with 40+ leading technology companies.

Olena, a former teacher from Kharkiv, completed the program and now works as a cloud solutions architect in Berlin. Dmytro, who studied civil engineering before the war, transitioned to data analytics and secured a position with a Fortune 500 company in Warsaw.

Join us in transforming lives through education. Partnership opportunities include curriculum development, mentorship programs, internship placements, and financial sponsorship. Together, we can create lasting impact for displaced students worldwide.
For more information, visit teei.org or contact partnerships@teei.org
